page.title: 19ARCHAEOLOGY IN LECHLADE CTD
page.content: A lot of{artefacts}have been found, mainly amber beads and saucer brooches. The richest find was a solid gold brooch adorned with garnets. Its value was Â£5000. Three swords, fifteen spearheads and numerous shield bosses have come to light. Other artefacts include buckets, pots, amulets, spinning items and a variety of tools and knives. The{Anglo Saxons}came to the Lechlade area around 400 A.D., having probably followed the route of the{RIVER THAMES}and an old Roman Road. The{Anglo Saxon Chronicle}states that they captured Cirencester in 577 A.D., which means that they had settled in Lechlade for well over a century before raiding there. Page twenty is an example of the creative work which arose from the excavation. Space demanded the poem be cut.
